messageBody:
Sorry, sent this too soo. Let me expand a bit.

On 9/29/05, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> On 9/29/05, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> >
> > I agree; so what's your point again?
>
>
> Don't force people to use statics when there is no need for them :-)
>

Making @BeforeClass work only on static methods defeats the purpose of this
feature.

Yes, @BeforeClass is meant to run before any test on this class is run, but
it is mostly used to initialize data that will be needed by each of these
test methods, and this data (and the test methods) are not static.

The main use we see in TestNG for the equivalent of @BeforeClass is to
initialize costly data that is typically read-only and used subsequently in
these test methods (big XML file, JDBC connection, etc...).

I think forcing it to run only on static methods is a mistake.

--
Cédric
